content.description: Make a slightly committing slab move off the ground to clip the first bolt and reach the shallow dike groove. (Alternatively it is possible to stand on the block just right of the start to clip the first bolt) Hand traverse left across the slab until you’re just below the second bolt. Mantle up to stand on the small groove and clip the second bolt. From here trust your feet and friction and head straight up to the anchor.
content.location: From the base of Gone Fishing and Sunny Side of the Moon, walk straight down the hill following the faint path this will be the first bolted slab you come to on the right.

content.description: Burly and powerful, under cling your way up the small left leaning overlap flake until it ends, then make your way past a series of desperate lock offs and dead points that finishes with a slopey dish top out. Originally it was rated 5.12a/b but key flakes have since broken off making it harder.
content.location: Located on Middle Sunset and the bottom of the low angle slab just before you turn to go around the corner to Dark Side of the Moon, and Gone Fishing, and just (climbers) left of Priapus Verde.

content.description: Do you like micro-face?  Follow the bolts up the slab and over a small but engaging roof pull. Fun.
content.protection: A few bolts.  A large cam in a horizontal if you wish.
content.location: This is the first route to the left of Mosaic. Shuts at the top.

content.description: Climb the face to the left of Sunny Side of the Moon past some small cracks in the large triangle shaped flake, leading to a thin crack and break in the overhang. Pull the overhanging finger crack through a brief but tall crux to a good jug followed by a crack in the slab that leads up to the anchor.
content.location: Stretch Mark is located just left of Sunny Side of the Moon, on the backside of the refrigerator box.

content.description: A short but interesting climb that works its way up a series of flakes past 3 bolts to a cruxy top out sequence on slopey dishes that ends at a bolt anchor up and right.
content.location: Located just (climbers) left and slightly down the slab of Mosaic and Sunburn, this is the bolted line on the right just before you go around the corner to Gone Fishing, Frigid Air, etc.

content.description: Make committing move off a boulder into a thin left leaning corner. Work up shallow corner by shuffling hands and pasting feet on numerous slabby footholds. Exit up and right at 3rd bolt.
content.protection: 4 bolts and anchors. Clip 1st bolt from boulder before you step onto face.
content.location: Easy to find. The first route you see when you arrive at Middle Sunset. After coming out of the small approach gully look north for 4 bolts and prominent left leaning corner.

content.description: Start on the big rock just outside of the wide chimney. Step across and into the chimney climbing up the left face, and staying close to the arête. Look for gear in small horizontals. Clip the bolt and stem between the two walls until it’s possible to place another small cam in a horizontal on the arête. Once you have good gear, make the cruxy committing move to get from a wide stem between the two walls in the chimney to fully established on the left slabby headwall. From here it’s not quite over, continue up the exciting and slabby arête past one more gear placement to the top.
content.protection: 1 bolt, doubles of .1”-.2” micro cams or C3s, bolt anchor
content.location: Located down the hill from Gone Fishing and Sunny Side of the Moon and just left of Uncle Garry had to Work.

content.description: A view not to be missed! Don’t let the 5.4 R start deter you from climbing this gem. Climb the runout start to a good gear placement in a horizontal, then stand up and clip the first bolt that protects the crux slab move. After the crux, move around the arete to the second bolt. Followed by a second runout section of 5.6 climbing along the arete and the shallow dike that leads to the anchors shared with stretch mark.
content.location: To the right of Stretch Mark, on the back side of the refrigerator box

content.description: Begin in short broken crack. Clip bolt and traverse left into 2nd short crack. Work up and left into 3rd overhanging left leaning crack.
content.location: From Mosaic walk along the descending base of the cliff line. Pass through vegetation that hugs the cliff, under an overhanging section of the wall and Gone Fishing will be the prominent overhanging northeast face.

content.description: Fun overhanging offwidth / lieback crack up the obvious corner.
content.protection: Medium to big cams (.75 - 5 Camalot). Bolted anchor on left wall.
content.location: Obvious corner left of the bolted climb Dark Side of the Moon.

content.description: Get off the ground in the Refrigerator crack corner, then step right and follow the bolt line up the dark and featured slab to shuts. Stays nice and cool on warm days.  Easy to toprope after climbing the crack.
content.location: On middle Sunset, scramble down the low angle slab (climber's left) and around the corner to your right.  Some excellent climbing lurks therein. This particular route is just right of the obvious Refrigerator Crack corner.

content.description: Right below the Upper Sunset Wall and above the Lower Sunset Wall
